website_summaries.verdict: If you've always wanted to own a pair of high-end "audiophile" headphones but can't quite justify dropping a grand on a pair, the superb sounding HiFiMan HE-400i is a good compromise.
pros: The HiFiMan HE-400i is a large, full-size headphone that uses planar-magnetic drivers for exceptional sound quality highlighted by first-rate clarity, detail and well-defined bass
The headphone is also lighter and more comfortable than its predecessor
cons: Headphone cord may be too short for some people

customer_reviews.title: Terrible build quality
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is terrible. After three months, the plastic snapped. Google "he 400i broken" for all the other people who had the same problem. I thought "I'll just super-glue it back together," but then when I looked at it, there were about five other little stress fractures waiting to break. Of course, it was about 10 days out of the return window when it broken. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Certain

customer_reviews.title: A HUGE VALUE!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these headphones. Very crisp, clean sound. Extremely comfortable. I own 7 pairs of phones, B&O H6, B&W P5, Beyerdynamics, Sennheiser 650, Bose & AudioTechnicas. I wanted to try the planar technology, so I tried these HiFiMan 400I. I believe they will be my favorite. They are worth the original $500 price, but at $250, they cannot be beat. Light, comfortable with tremendous soundstage. They do not leak as much as the Beyerdynamic DT 990-Premium 600, but a bit more than the Sennhieser 650s. The cord is a little short, so I am buying the longer replacement cord. I recommend these cans to anyone that loves music!!
customer_reviews.author: Cliff M

customer_reviews.title: Detailed with spacious soundstage. Great with good gear
customer_reviews.text: Sound awesome now... didn’t at first. The instructions say “break in for 150 hours.” Take em seriously! These sound too bright and really bass shy at first. Play the radio through them in a drawer for a week then have a listen...and wow. What a difference. When they break in though you’ll hear your music in a new way if your coming from the lowfi world. Bass still isn’t heavy in these unless the music was recorded that way. But that’s what hifi guys want right? These are detailed and produce a spacious soundstage that will ruin cheap headphones for you forever.
customer_reviews.author: Anna E. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Headphone broke after 4 months of easy use
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were adult owned and I only used them at my desk. Within 4 months of easy use the plastic that holds the cup broke when I went to put them on my head. These were used with Care and I always had them on a headphone stand when not in use. I would avoid these headphones. They sounded great, but cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Jabroni744

customer_reviews.title: Plastic speaker arms brake in the same spot.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic speaker arm snapped, I don't know when. I just picked it up and it was broken on the right speaker. I then noticed the left speaker arm is cracked and ready to break also, in the exact same spot as the right one. This proves to me that this a design flaw. I bought the extended warranty, thankfully, but I choose a refund over a replacement. What's the point, it will just brake again. I can't stress enough how lightly and infrequently these were used, in just three months.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable at this Price Point
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were very solid for full retail price. For the current price point, you simply can't beat these headphones. These were my first foray into the realm of "better" headphones (not cheaper cans or IEMs), and I have been nothing but happy. I paired these with a nice high-res player and a DAC/amp, and they sound great. I find myself getting lost in the music, and music I've heard a thousand times excites me all over again. If you're looking to dip your toes in audiophile waters, you can't find a better entry point anywhere near this price level.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R. Dodson

customer_reviews.title: 5 min out of the box and the Y splitter in the cable is already having poor connection and losing signal from the left ear
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think it was even possible to have these types of manufacturing defects in 2018. 5 min out of the box and the Y splitter in the cable is already having poor connection and any minute movements of the head will cause audio to blip in and out of either or both ears. I've never seen sub-0.5$ airline giveaway headphones have as poor a quality as these. For the love of humanity, this company needs to disband right this moment. Besides implementation failures, the design is poor as well. The Y splitter which is excessively large with unnecessary right angles basically act like fish hooks and catches only absolutely everything.
customer_reviews.author: Xster

customer_reviews.title: Needs a good amp - Atom, Liquid Spark, etc. for getting the Best..
customer_reviews.text: Provided you listen with them driven by a good headphone 100db SNR amp (JDS Atom, Monoprice Liquid Spark, etc.), you will experience great dynamic range, and full-but-tight bass.. Drive them with anything else (smartphone/tablet 3.5mm, dongle, thumb DAC/amp, etc.) and you will be missing out. Bass will be thin, dynamic range will compressed - definitely much worse. So much worse that I switch to Phillips SHP9500 in the non-amp situation. But driven correctly, they are far more enjoyable than my SHP9500 and anything else I have tried. Perhaps the best $179 - $199 phones currently available. Note- make sure you order the HE400i, Not the similarly priced HE400s.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound!
customer_reviews.text: I've listened to headphones that cost several times as much as these and these sound just as good if not better. Construction is adequate - they are not made to be dropped or handled roughly given plastic parts but so far no problems. The sound is great - very detailed and not bass heavy or too bright (bass heads may not like them but bass certainly not lacking here). You have to like open back headphones as they leak sound to those around you but open back phones always rate best in reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Meticulous

customer_reviews.title: Amazing soundstage, aesthetic value, and audio quality. Has me listening to "fancy" songs instead of my standard pop songs :)
customer_reviews.text: As my first pair of audiophile headphones, I'm shocked by the "sound stage". A random bell or buzz will have me looking over my shoulder, then realizing the sound came from the phones. They sound really nice! I'm also shocked at how my normal go-to songs (pop, rock, or metal) do not bring the excitement of a fully 3-dimensional song. Pros: lightweight perfect length cord for mobile phone listening sound stage audio quality aesthetics Cons: A lot of sound will bleed in and bleed out (as to be expected of open headphones such as these). I listen to them at work at a low volume and there is the benefit of hearing when someone needs your assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality was 10/10. Then they broke.
customer_reviews.text: I run a pretty endgame setup. My dad and amp are transparent as they come. When paired with the HE-400i, it was beautiful and then some. But unfortunately, even though I treated these very delicately, my pair succumbed to the dreaded breakage. Specifically, the cheap plastic part that rotates the cups up and down. No matter how good the sound quality is, I had these for less than a year. I hate to say this about a product with such good sound, but as it stands, the quality control is just too poor to recommend this. Drop has some excellent options within the same price range that probably won't break on ya.
customer_reviews.author: cloud nine

customer_reviews.title: Nice cans.
customer_reviews.text: I like 'em. I wear these at work and listening at very low volumes I can easily hear office discussion and music. The sound is very balanced at low volumes but performs better with an amplifier. I have an pretty big head as well and find these very comfortable. So far I would buy these again for sure. Still loving these for sure but the cable provided is terrible. Stiff and unforgiving, the only replacements I have found are too expensive. Knowing what I know now I would still buy these cans. Another update... did i mention the cable sucks? try this one instead:
customer_reviews.author: Marc M

customer_reviews.title: The best planar headphones for the price point!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely one of the best headphones around. In my opinion Planar headphones are supreme. I've compared the 400i's to others twice the price.. including The Sundara's. These cans are fast, airy, transparent plus an excellent soundstage. After purchasing these you might also want to go with the massdrop version 4XX for another Superior sound of the same. I've noticed many people leaving negative feedback on the earlier model due to build quality. If you purchase the aux 3.5 I can assure you you will have no problem. At 57 years of age these have to be one of the best headphones ever made.. especially at this price point for $180.00.. they're practically giving them away. Just buy!
customer_reviews.author: Camacho

customer_reviews.title: Go elsewhere, customer service is terrible, not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: They sound great, however, due to poor build quality and terrible customer service I would recommend to AVOID Hifiman. I had to replace the cable after a few months with an aftermarket one, and now at 10 months the ear pads started to come apart. I reached out to Hifiman customer service to see if it was still under warranty and could be replaced and was encountered a weirdly combative and unhelpful CS rep. It took multiple days to have a conversation, as he was in China and only e-mailed at 12-1am est. For my next purchase, I'll be looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Van Glahn

customer_reviews.title: These are definitely a new sound for those who've never ventured into planar territory
customer_reviews.text: These sound great for the most part, they have some weird buzz on heavy bass. I can only speculate the QC for these isn't the best, I still enjoy them but if these were at a higher price point there would be no end to my rage (bottled up and sealed with tears as it may be). They're good enough to revisit often even with Senn HD 660S on deck. Being the meme tier headphones type as I may be these have set me on a path to one day acquire Audeze LCDs of some variety eventually. Gotta escape the planar Chi-Fi some day am-I-right?
customer_reviews.author: Nick oi

customer_reviews.title: Worked Wonderfully for Just Three Days. Sad.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the sound of these headphones out of the box. Very lively and engaging. Great clarity and detail. I liked the fact that the low impedance negated any need for a headphones amp. It really disappointed me that after just three days of normal use the headphones started to pop, crackle, and distort. I hated to have to return them but they were defective and I guess I have to add my experience to the list of those who have had bad experiences with HiFiMan's quality control.
customer_reviews.author: raspeaker

customer_reviews.title: Rattle in right driver, returned
customer_reviews.text: Had a rattle in the right driver. Most noticeable at low frequencies. General sound quality was fine but I was expecting more. Driving with schiit stack. Highs were lacking imo. Probably would have kept them if they didn’t rattle. At this price I expect better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Amazing clarity! I'm still stunned.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones I've ever listened to. The bass surprised me. The response on planars must be close to electrostats as well. Motorhead on these is heaven. My Beyerdynamic DT770 headphones cannot produce as much on the low end spectrum. I know I'm all over the place but these phones touch everything Amazing feat of engineering for $220. Even if you pay $350, they would be a steal. Hopefully my Massdrop HD650's are as good. Massdrop takes forever to ship them though .Planars are superior for speed metal in my opinion. Hopefully the HDxxx Sennheisers prove me wrong though. Side notes: DAC- JDS Labs OLDAC Amp-JDS O2 (Massdrop) You could go with Schitt prodctts as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bodom

customer_reviews.title: Dynamic Detail
customer_reviews.text: These can’s blew me away, & I was hearing instruments in a way I hadn’t before. Always try new headphones out with the music you tend to go to most. Planar magnetic drivers are very detailed & this is my first pair with those. Not disappointed with the sound, however Hifiman does have issues with QC, as has been pointed Out by other reviewers. I had to return the first pair due to cosmetic issue, but great sound.!
customer_reviews.author: SCR

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I chose these HIFIMAN HE-400I headphones based on reviews from Consumer Reports as well as other review sites. I am primarily interested in classical music. The clarity of sound and spacial definition of these headphones did not disappoint. While the sound is excellent for classical music that is well recorded, I feel that they also reproduce other music types well. They have been comfortable for relatively extended listening periods. I have not had any durability issues so far (two months) but did elect to purchase insurance based on the many Amazon reviews of poor construction quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: For anyone upgrading from Audio-Technica
customer_reviews.text: I have some experience with ATHM50x's (5-6 years). This headphone may surprise you or be "underwhelming" if you are coming from a pair of colored, "fun" cans like Audio-Technica's M40/50x's, due to the fact they honestly require some power. With a proper EQ and power driving these headphones, you'll be absolutely blown away. It's like a different pair of headphones. However, plugging them into your phone, for example, may result in a very different sound signature than you'll be used to. I have a V35, and the relatively low impedance on this pair of headphones will NOT trigger the high impedance mode, and the phone's 75% (its max) sounds to me like 33%-ish on the M50x's.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Change the Pads and wow
customer_reviews.text: When I initially bought these headphones I would have rated them for about 3 stars. 3.5 maybe. But not wanting to pre-judge I waited till they were broken in a little bit and got a tube amp to drive them and that went to a 4. I wasn't upset but I expected more. And then today, I changed the earpads from stock to leather. And let me just say my mind is blown. If you do anything buy these, change the pads, drive them, and mannnn. Just wow. Full sound, the right amount of punch, way more comfortable than the originals which felt like hell after short wear, and above all did I mention sound?
customer_reviews.author: Gray M. Edwards Jr.

customer_reviews.title: If you wear behind the ear hearing aids, these work great!
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable over a 2-3 hour period, block plenty of background noise, and provide outstanding sound quality. They are the first of this type that I can wear with enjoyment. Shipping was excellent, the product arrived on time and was very well protected. One technical note of caution: my batteries seem to fail very quickly while wearing these for hours. This is not a fault with the earphones; it's just a fact of physics with electronic hearing aids.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Known to break
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the suggestion of a friend and co-worker who loved his. Sadly what he did not tell me and what I didnt take the time to research was is how often these break. From cheap glue on the ear pads to audio ports that stop working all together these are nice when you first get them. But shortly after you notice the corners that have been cut.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality.
customer_reviews.text: I've had many headphones thru the years including Beyerdynamic and Sennheizer. I was using the HD650 for my everyday listening. But when I got the HIFI Man HE400I they've become my goto everyday phones. They include the best sound I could hear from the HD650 and the HD600 plus more. One thing is for sure, they do need a long break in period. Many of the criticisms I read about them I heard also. But these sonic problems went away after a long break in period.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Peterson

customer_reviews.title: The steal of the century !!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to try a set of planar-magnetics for years. When this $500 model started selling for $188 (not sure why), I pulled the trigger. WOW. Finally found a headphone that surpasses my reference HD650 Sennheisers. Fast, liquid, light-on-their-feet, extended at both extremes, airy treble, and the QUALITY of the bass can be startling. UNCONDITIONALLY recommended. My only complaints: not as comfy as the "Sennies", and the CABLE IS TOO SHORT !!!!
customer_reviews.author: WickyFrog

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for long listening sessions
customer_reviews.text: The build quality seems good, the sound quality is good, too, though with open-back design you can hear background noise. The problem with these headphones is its weight. Though the ear cups are cushioned and soft, and the headband seals the cups over your ears, the weight will soon make wearing the headphones uncomfortable. I was too lazy to return them for refund, but I caution others to audition them for at least two hours, what a movie on Netflix might run, to see whether they're comfortable over that much time.
customer_reviews.author: Rainys A. Blekaitis

customer_reviews.title: simply amazing for price point
customer_reviews.text: best headphones under $200 ever. edit - one and a half years later with 5-10 hours of use a day. Cable and ear cup pads replaced and it still holds up. The sound is amazing and as good as much higher priced headphones. also if you wear headphones for long periods of time you'll greatly appreciate the open backs, trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent!
customer_reviews.text: I urge any audiophile to purchase these magnificent headphones for home use. Plugged into a high quality amplifier, these will thrill you with their sound quality. The build quality and even the packaging declare these to be from a superior manufacturer. And the drastic price reduction makes them a steal!!! While the fact they are open turned out not to be overly loud for public use, they did not perform nearly so well when used with either a desktop or laptop computer. For those uses, see my positive review for the Presonus H9 closed ear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great sound regardless of price, but at the price they can't be beat.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot imagine a better set of headphones for critical listening, at anywhere near this price point. They are completely open-back, no isolation. These headphones have the most effortless, realistic low bass I've ever strapped to my skull. They don't exaggerate or boom, but they seamless integration of an acoustic upright bass is so good, it's hard to describe. I listened to a lot of "professional" and "studio" phones before buying these. None made music like the Hifiman 400i.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerdog

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing sounding headphones!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphones!! .Nice built, luxurious packaging and a crystal clear sound across all frequencies!! . I can't recommend them enough!! Though I already own the highly praised AKG K712, SENNHEISER HD 600 and FOSTEX T50 RP MK3 all of which are amazing in their own right,I honestly feel the HIFIMAN 400I are a very nice addition to my collection. Beware you'll need a nice amp to get the most out of them. In my case, I am using an OBJECTIVE 2 and I'm happy to report it easily drives all of them without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Boris Trejos

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great! EXTREMELY comfortable! Cons: - Cable is really low quality. Keeps cutting out and making static sounds. Definitely need to have this replaced - Bass is there, and feels good but does lack on some level. Just doesn't feel "full" if that makes any sense -1 star because the cable these came with is a complete joke. $250 headphones yet they can't provide a cable that works?
customer_reviews.author: T1T2T3

customer_reviews.title: Defective on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Got these headphones because they have a low impedance and be used with my phone to listen to music without needing an amp. however I noticed that the right earpiece would go in and out after first use and became progressively worse within the first day. I was expecting better quality from hifi headphones. It is a shame because i heard a lot of good things about these headphones. I am ordering a replacement - hopefully this pair was a fluke and the new pair will live up to expectation
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from DT990
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I bought these to replace my DT 990's and I was kinda sceptical of how much of an improvement these would be. I searched around a lot for something DT 990 "like" and came to the decision between the 400i and 400S. Finally after searching fourm after fourm I pulled the trigger and am actually pretty blown away by the sound quality. I'm using a JDS labs 02 Amp revision B. The dac is run from the optical. Really comfortable headphones. They do get hotter on your ears than the DT990, but its worth the trade off for the sound improvement. All in all I'm very happy with em!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Brittle plastic breakage... beware.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic connecting the ear "muff" broke for literally no reason. The Y part. Absolutely insane. It must be extremely brittle... I have crap 30 dollar Sony headphones that are have lasted for years. These? 6 weeks. With only about 4 hours of use (except for the burn in time playing for 5 days... Hey, they sounded great. Need to look elsewhere I guess. Also, the nice box that was described was not included. Some normal cheap throw away that was pathetic as compared to what I saw in all the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: ULTRA CLEAR and CLEAN
customer_reviews.text: STARTLING!! Streaming Cassandra Wilson on Tidal (mqa,DragonFly Red with Jitter Bug) was simpy jaw dropping. l use to laugh at audio reviewers who would use such adjectives. The background was SILENT, then her VOICE was right next to me ULTRA CLEAR and in my face. The track was Love ls Blindness. The DEAD SILENT and CLEAR background came about via the dragon and the bug. When removed them, and pluged directly into desk top, all silence and magic was gone.
customer_reviews.author: leonardis williams

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!! A++++
customer_reviews.text: I paired these with a Sony PHA-1A DAC/AMP and the result is fabulous! I tested with an iPhone 6S running the Korg iAudiogate app with direct digital out using the lightning port. I also tested with a Sony NW-ZX100 also using direct digital from the Walkman port. Both devices used the same AUDIO tracks in various formats including AAC, FLAC, ALAC, WAV, and DSD. These tracks included recordings encoded at 44.1/16, 96/24, 192/24, and DSD 2.8. Bottom line: 1st Class audio performance. If you use the PHA-1A, I recommend setting the GAIN to HIGH with this headset. On a side note, the NW-ZX100 can drive the headset adequately without an AMP.
customer_reviews.author: L. Perez

customer_reviews.title: which I know is not as great as FLAC or a CD directly
customer_reviews.text: I got these with a monoprice DAC, and have been blown away by them. I will admit that I am listening mostly to Spotify streaming at the highest quality, which I know is not as great as FLAC or a CD directly, but these headphones have been stellar. Very comfortable and discovering new bits to songs that I've known for years every day.
customer_reviews.author: seboz

customer_reviews.title: My second pair
customer_reviews.text: Because the recently Sundara model appearance, the price of He400i has drop from 450$ to 169$ in just 2 years. I just consider my reference from this headphone, balanced, fast and intimate. The materials aren’t top, my previous pair (working fine) are falling apart by the head band, that’s why I decided to buy another one. If I need more bass, I change to closed ones (Takstar & Taotronic). If I need more scene, going to Fidelio. Punchier, Beyerdynamic. More rock’n’roller, Grado. But in the end, the ones I enjoy the most are this ones.
customer_reviews.author: Carles

customer_reviews.title: A great deal at $219
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are spectacular with the FiiO USB DAC. You can drive them off a phone or tablet, but the amp makes a world of difference. Also be sure to do the 150 hours of break-in as they improve dramatically with use. I do just some slight eq adjustments with a program called Boom on my Mac, but I'm not a purist. I've had Bose, Sennheiser & AKG but these are the first planar magnetics I've owned & they are light years ahead of the standard driver types that I've listened to. A great deal at $219.00 so if it's even less than that.... BUY THEM!
customer_reviews.author: P.S.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable for me
customer_reviews.text: While I like the sound from the HE-400is, I found them to be very uncomfortable. The headband is way too tight, causing excessive pressure around my ears. I do have a large head, so this won't be the case for all users. But if you do have a large head, I suggest shopping for other headphones. I hope that the headband will "relax" a bit with time. It is a spring type of steel, so it may do that.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones! I have multiple ear buds and full sized cans and these are the best I have owned. The amount of musical detail they reveal is impressive. Even older music comes alive with musical components I had never noticed. Very smooth at all volumes as long as you have an amp strong enough to drive them. An iPhone or android phone do NOT have enough power to drive them well enough to bring out their best. In my opinion these are an extraordinary value, would like to hear the HE-560 phones...
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Crutcher

customer_reviews.title: Easily Broken Headband But Until Then It Sounds Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought my headphones in December 2018 for daily office use. They were incredibly comfortable and the sound quality was great. Unfortunately, after a few months I accidentally knocked them off my desk (just a few feet off the ground) and the plastic connector for the ear piece and headband broke. It doesn't really matter how good they sound if you can't wear them. Hifi does sell a replacement headband, but it costs $75.00. Apparently the replacement headbands come with a stainless steel inner core now to prevent this kind of problem. So, be warned, this version doesn't have the new and improved resistant to breaking headband.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rucker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent audiophile quality musical reproduction
customer_reviews.text: Excellent audiophile quality musical reproduction. Very comfortable. The planar design is more audiophile engineering than consumer, so you're getting an excellent product. It is also very well made. Note: it is an open back design, not closed, so you'll hear your wife calling for you or anything else going on around you. The soundstage is different than a closed back design. I am not sure that was made clear in description. Most high audiophile headphones are like this; you just need to know it's open and not closed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lee Webb

customer_reviews.title: I sent these back
customer_reviews.text: These are interesting. I'd say for a lot of people they are a great entry point into the planar sound, which to me, is overrated. It really comes down to preference. These have a good overall sound that unfortunately comes across very dry and thin. It doesn't sound natural. Separation is good. Detail is great for the price but they feel very soulless. They aren't cold (a little warm for me), just thin. This is more of a planar issue.
customer_reviews.author: Audionerd

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye dynamic transduction!
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic set of headphones. These guys are pretty much neutral, with a slight peak in the treble, clear as day mids and an outstanding ruler flat bass response (for the price especially) you won't find in many dynamics. I don't think I'll ever buy dynamic transducer headphones again; I wouldn't be able to live without this! After this point, I feel like diminishing returns in headphone audio quality start to really take effect. The cable is sturdy though it could be a little bit longer. The comfort is excellent for my above average head and ear size. I really have no glaring flaws for these things. I absolutely love them.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Love <3
customer_reviews.text: They were purchased as an upgrade from the DT 990 Pros. They exceeded expectations. Outstanding detail. On the neutral side, but they have perfect bass to my ears. Driving them with my Sony UDA-1 is easy, and they pair well. They're outstanding. Very nice for classical, and other worldly with rock. I also use them when gaming on console and PC through my UDA-1...they're perfection. I'm not one of those audiophile types who goes into detail. All I know is that this setup passes the ear test. It's not going anywhere for a LONG time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Golden

customer_reviews.title: Great sound - audiophile review.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to wear (relatively lightweight). Sound is well balanced and detailed without being fatiguing. Tight bass, not overwhelming. Great sound stage. Great value for $200, will keep and recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the quality of an otherwise great set of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these with much enthusiasm, they deliver crystal clear sound quality and I am now a believer in open back headphones. But they broke after 3 months. I took them off my head and the plastic around the left ear cup snapped right off. These have been pampered and have not been dropped or mistreated in any way. Very disappointed in the quality of an otherwise great set of headphones. Bummer. Big thanks to Amazon for the refund, and the next headphones I buy will be from a different company.
customer_reviews.author: McNeedy KenNeedy

customer_reviews.title: These sound amazing. The build quality on mine seem fine
customer_reviews.text: These sound amazing. The build quality on mine seems fine, I'll post again if i find any problems. They do need a strong input source. Also, the vender managed to get these to me the next day with no extra shipping costs. Update: So i tested the build quality of these by drinking a litter of vodka and then drunkenly dropping them on my back deck. The headband broke, but Mark at HIFIMAN customer service sent me a free replacement after a couple quick emails. I would say I'd buy these again, but i actually already have as a gift for someone.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound. Magnetic planar technology is definitely weird, first set of cans I've experienced with them. Might not be able to go back to anything else. Build quality great. Clamp for can make your head hurt a bit, but only need to be adjusted and won't pose too much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Headband broke after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound for the price but using it everyday for 2 months now and I'm seeing ear cups are coming apart at the seems with the plastic headband breaking too. So I have to spend $75 for another headband just after 2 month of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Human Rights

customer_reviews.title: Sound good, not the best bang for the buck though.
customer_reviews.text: All and all these are great. Sound is amazing. Not alot of bass, but what you get is very clean and layered. Highs are very sweet and smooth. Mids are really good as well. Now do they sound better than my Phillip's 9500 yes, not a 130 dollars better though. I did like them enough to hang on my headphone wall. I own about 40 pairs of over the ear and iems and if you take price out these are at the top, but bang for your buck towards the bottom. I'd go with the Phillip's 9500 for 70 bucks. 95% as good at a 1/3 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Audio Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good affordable planars
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great sounding headphones. Low price for planar magnetic headphones Cons Build Quality - I've had for two months as a daily driver, and the ear cushions have started to fall off. I've glued them back on for now. Reading other reviews before buying, I question the longevity of these. I'd only recommend these as an entry level planars if you are gentle with them.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with broken hinge at swivel point
customer_reviews.text: I got my nice new pair of headphones out of the box brand new today. But as soon as I looked them over the plastic hinge where is swivels it broken and cracked badly. So to say the least the durability must be non existent unless I was just shipped a broken or faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Immortal Mark

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Good customer service. Great sound quality. Depending on your audio player, volume output can be less than required. Plenty of volume on my phone. Sometimes could use more volume when listening on the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: J. Snow

customer_reviews.title: Like the sound but the hardware quality is very poor
customer_reviews.text: The right half of earpad weared off quickly although the left side is still OK. The original cable broken then I purchased a 2nd cable from hifiman, the cable is expensive 69$ and it broken again. then I puchased another replacement cable but it only fit one side, since the same jack could fit in the other side, it's the mistake of the headphone, I pretty regret the purchase, after five year and 299$+69$ I got a useless headphone, as a comparision, I purchased K701 at 260$. After 7 years, I am able to resell it for 120$
customer_reviews.author: AZ

customer_reviews.title: Way too good of a headphones for the price.
customer_reviews.text: With a very descent Amp/Dac you got yourself a very great sound system right on top of your head. They are very comfortable to ware. After hours of listening I forgot if I even ware them. For the price I paid for them it's a steal. They were on sale for $249 on amazon. That's a steal. They run $299 normally and yet that's a great price to good for what they can do. They are not pretty and they are huges. I was very surprise to see how big they are, but man they sound great. They are very light as well.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Not magical like Grado headphones
customer_reviews.text: This is a good headphone and after a fair amount of break in time they got better. They just don't image as good as my Grado SR80 headphones. They don't project a wide enough soundstage so the music is stuck in between and behind my ears. It's difficult getting used to it but not objectionable. The details are great and so is the low end. Build quality is good and they are pretty comfortable they just aren't magical like the Grado headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Jackson

customer_reviews.title: ... my first pair of planar magnetic headphones and I love them. I tried v-moda crossfade and the earpieces ...
customer_reviews.text: They're my first pair of planar magnetic headphones and I am still satisfied with my purchase after 3 months. I tried v-moda crossfade and the earpieces were too small, even after purchasing the larger ones. These are fairly comfortable, but after 3 or so hours my ears do start to hurt from them. I never had this problem with my logitech g35 headset. These really do have excellent sound quality. I'm not an audiophile, but I can tell a difference when listening to music and playing pc games. My biggest complaint would be the cord length. It really needs to be 2-3 feet longer.
customer_reviews.author: Shlean

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Noticeable improvement from the older generation (friend had the older ones) this version is lighter and has even more of the "open back" aspect. Great sound stage for the size. Also only uses 3.5 mm all around (both to plug into the headphones themselves and your device).
customer_reviews.author: Rohit Advani

customer_reviews.title: excellent sound
customer_reviews.text: great set of headphones. maybe they aren't pure audiophile headphones but for 99% of people these will be awesome. they are open backed so they will leak noise but they sound great, feel well made, are very comfortable, and i love the quirky look. if down the road you buy an amp, they will get even better.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Already broken
customer_reviews.text: Broke within two months. The right ear won’t play sound. I will try ordering replacement cables
customer_reviews.author: Jinn Tingle

customer_reviews.title: nice-->not nice
customer_reviews.text: i like them for the price. had the bridge break. notified Hifiman and they shipped me a new headband. easy to swap. still scared they will break again though. i wish they had an option to switch to a different. sounds good. -->they broke again. do not buy unless you know how to get a after market headband that will work on these. -->emailed Hifiman. this time they shipped me the Sundara metal headband. have to take some screws out and put them back. in the end they are working again.
customer_reviews.author: tyler

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: My previous headphones were the m50x and the difference in quality is night and day. The 400i is much clearer and better sounding overall. The mids actually exist now. Voices, guitars and such sound amazing. The bass is a little bit lower in quantity, however is it much higher in quality and somehow I can feel it more now too?? also, the highs are super sparkly and enjoyable... they get pretty up there, but know when to stop just before they get painful or sibilant. Honestly these headphones are at least 3x better than the m50x and the difference in price is only like $60.. pretty crazy value actually
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Kruspe

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones - quite a bit more HF top end ...
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones - quite a bit more HF top end than my dynamic phones. For comparison others I own are DT880-250ohms and Status OB-1. OB-1 has better bass and more sensitivity but the HE-400i has a lot more top end sparkle. A good value and well built planar phones. Compared to DT880-250ohms. top end is extended and more sparkle but DT880 seems more balanced over entire range. The HE400i needs a good headphone amp though.
customer_reviews.author: James L

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Sounded great until the left speaker started to rattle after 6 months. I'm not the most gentle person, so it was probably my fault. I haven't contacted the manufacturer, don't really care to. I like to fix things myself, it keeps me busy, so I can't advise you on dealings with the company. Construction seems fairly simple compared to some other headphones I've disassembled. I am confident I will be able to fix them when I return to the U.S. If I can't I'll just re purpose the planar elements for some other project.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neutral and Transparent
customer_reviews.text: Neutral and Transparent. I don't know how it brings out all the details without being bright. I have not found even a single genre which is not good with their headphones. I pair them with Astell & Kern AK Jr.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding headphones I own
customer_reviews.text: Best sounding headphones I own. And I own Senn HD 380 Pro, Senn HD 650 and Senn HD 800. Saving up for HE 1000. Planer headphones are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Edmunds

customer_reviews.title: Close but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I do like these quite a bit. And would recommend them to anyone, as long as you can get them on sale. Not sure I'd push them at full price. The sound is pretty amazing, especially if you have a lot of power pushing them. But, the lows are a little lacking compared to others I own. And the pads can get to be uncomfortable after a hour or so. They really need a little thicker pad. That said, they really are not a bad set of cans. I just don't think they warrant 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: George T

customer_reviews.title: Poor build on headband, but recieved free upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is excellent with a powerful headphone amp. Very open. Headband on mine cracked after just 2 months of light use. Contacted Hifiman and they quickly sent a replacement that seems to be a different (less shiny) plastic and has had no problem.
customer_reviews.author: PJ Sage

customer_reviews.title: Great audio!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing audio, have these hooked up to a Mayflower Electronics ARC and the audio is great! Going to try it on my Schiit Stack (Magni 3 + Modi 3) to see what it is like on there.
customer_reviews.author: Krzysztof

customer_reviews.title: Best mid fi planer headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Great blend of lows mids and highs. Good sound stage with excellent image placement. Crystal clear and smooth-with 50+ hours of break in. Super comfortable to wear with good build quality. My favorite all rounder phones.Wait till they go on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: still burn in but so far so good 48 hour already this is second review and very critical problem the head phone not last long because the material holding the cans in my case just last 1 week cheap plastic see the pictures don't buy until they change those thing with better holding material reduce 4 star 200 dollars but trash beware.
customer_reviews.author: Thanh K Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: The bass of course isn't as deep as you would get with closed ear headphones but it has a great deep punch to it
customer_reviews.text: As a person that only cares for clarity and punch, these are the way to go. The bass of course isn't as deep as you would get with closed ear headphones but it has a great deep punch to it. The mids are crispy and detailed and the highs are enormous. This is a great pair of headphones if you're looking to spend a little bit of money. Just remember Top of the line headphones costs 1,000$+. For this price, you cannot beat them!
customer_reviews.author: Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone, and even better with an amp!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphones. I paired them with an amp and OMG they sound good. Amazing width of soundstage. Anybody who wears these at my place are like "holy ****!" Course... I also have bass shakers in my couch which go a LONG way towards maintaining the cinematic experience during late night viewing. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: MistOfAshes

customer_reviews.title: good sound and comfortable, super worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Just got this he 400i, feel Super comfortable, For the sound quality, super good. I really like Sennheiser brand, sound stage feels more accurate to the live stage. Compare to the audio Technica M50x BT. My opinion, Sennheiser is way better.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Chui

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound - Really Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as my first open backed headphone, even comparing to the Focal (closed back) or Meze (close back) these have a super nice sound and are excellent for classical music all around. I've really enjoyed these and am very impressed with comfort and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B.

customer_reviews.title: I've owned many pairs of audiophile quality headphones in my life and have never experienced this level of poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: Had these for just over 4 weeks before both ear cups snapped off of the plastic headband simultaneously. I've owned many pairs of audiophile quality headphones in my life and have never experienced this level of poor build quality. I'd pass on these if I were you. You can read scores of bad reviews here that state a similar experience which saves me the trouble of reiterating. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B. Tinney

customer_reviews.title: frequently bought together: he-400i + JBweld
customer_reviews.text: Headphones sounded amazing! Best headphones I’ve ever owned... for 1 month... the plastic on th Y connection to the ear cup broke for no reason, I just lifted the headphones up to my head and they snapped completely off. Which leads into my next review! Thank you JBweld for always being reliable and holding strong! Especially when lost warranties and unhelpful customer support falls through. Honestly, every he-400i should come with a tube of JBweld! 5 Stars... for JBweld of course!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Truly excellent home use headphones
customer_reviews.text: Just received these so they haven't been used for 150 hours yet. Still, I can hear a definite improvement over my former favorite AudioQuest NightHawk headphones. The sound stage is better, the high tones are heard much better, and I keep discovering new details in music that I've heard over and over hundreds of times. They are even a bit more comfortable than the NightHawk headphones, which surprised me. I bet that in another 149.50 hours, these headphones will sound like a dream come true! The short cable, 1.5 meters, is perfect for me as I sit just next to my Audio gd NFB 11.28 TXCO DAC.
customer_reviews.author: Mikael

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe these are the #1 recommended headphone by the Wirecutter
customer_reviews.text: I just got these based on the review by the Wirecutter (they rank them the #1 ranked open back headphone). After receiving them, plugging them into the interface, and playing some music, I was incredibly disappointed. 1. They are incredibly uncomfortable to wear. I can't imagine wearing these for 10 minutes, let alone a day. 2. The basses are sorely lacking. Pretty much no bass comes through. How the Wirecutter missed this, I do not know. I gave up and am sending them back today. Planning on getting Sennheiser 599's instead, which seem like they're better rated on Amazon anyways. Last time I get a 3 star product!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with channel imbalance
customer_reviews.text: Arrived to me with a channel imbalance, as the right channel was audibly louder than the left. Ignroing this however the sound quality was questionable. Bass was present, but not very strong. The midrange almost sounded compressed, the highs were bright but not horrible. Sound signature wasn't great, and this on top of the quality control issues means that I cannot recommend this pair to anyone. There are far better options in this price point, such as Sennheiser 500 series, Beyerdynamic DT series (even the DT990), and I'd even go as far as to recommend cheaper headphones like Koss Porta Pros or KSC75s over these.
customer_reviews.author: Metal Neon

customer_reviews.title: Really like them after new pads.
customer_reviews.text: I quite using hd-600's and dt-990's after buying these. Best I have ever bought. One thing I did was replace the ear-pads with ones called alpha pads. The pads are rectangle in shape and the ear space is bigger for a better fit over my ears. More comfortable than the stock ones. I also noticed more bass with the new pads. Like it so much I bought a new dac/amp to power them.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Sound alright, but extremely poor build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Just like other reviews, my headset is broken. Not even after a year, the cups have ripped and fallen off. Definitely going back to dt990s.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality control, the inner 2.5mm connectors are loose and they disconnect from time to time making a creaking sound that is awful. Even the slightest neck or head movement makes the driver disconnects from the cable and make a sound as if I were listening to a loud tv with no signal on.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos H.

customer_reviews.title: Very Spacious Soundstage. Clear Sound Quality. Totally Worth the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth it for use at home or private places. Get a DAC and headphone amplifier, though. I got the Fiio EK17 DAC/AMP for $99 and it works great and works with my Nexus 6P. It's bigger than USB stick size DACs/AMPs but it's also $100 cheaper than the Dragonfly Red DAC/AMP. Music sounds so much better now with these headphones and my external DAC/AMP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: These are decent headphones, but I've replaced the cables and earpads already, in contrast to my Shure SRH840 (bought them around 6 years ago) still stock. Wont buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ceps

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from these headphones
customer_reviews.text: Purchase at your own risk. I’m writing this review within five minutes of taking them out of the box. Presentation? It’s beautiful. However, as soon as I plugged these headphones into my amp, I noticed that there was no sound coming out of the left cup. That just goes to show how terrible the build quality of these headphones are. HiFiMan will NEVER get another dime out of me.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The manufacturer recommends a 150 hour burn in period. I'm 50 hours into it, and these cans sound great. I can't speak to the build quality, since I've only had them for a few days. The Hifiman customer service is great. I called them shortly after placing my order and they were extremely helpful and responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Marcg

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the money
customer_reviews.text: I listen to these more than anything that I have these days. The are excellent with balanced equipment and cables.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon H.

customer_reviews.title: Clear, articulate, full-range sound!
customer_reviews.text: My first planar magnetic headphones and I couldn't be any happier. These sound fantastic. Feeding them Amazon Music HD through my dac, tube buffer and headphone amp. Sounds great with all music genres.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Lovern

customer_reviews.title: TOO HEAVY. NOT COMFORTABLE. SOUND SO SO.
customer_reviews.text: BEAUTIFUL BUILD QUALITY. TOO HEAVY. NOT COMFORTABLE. SWEATY EARS. SOUND IS JUST SO SO. GO GET JLAB AUDIO OMNI PREMIUM BLUETOOTH WIRELESS HEADPHONES $59.99 AND YOU WILL BE HAPPY FOREVER.
customer_reviews.author: MARK P.

customer_reviews.title: just wow, much meow
customer_reviews.text: These are really really good audiophile quality headphones. Plays a really wide spectrum of sounds. They are my new go to head phone over my Bose QC. The progressive trance sounded better on the QC's since they produce more of a shimmery closed off sound but these are amazing for everything else. And then if you plug it into an amp.. well just tell people what you want on your tombstone cuz you are never leaving your computer again.
customer_reviews.author: minori a.

customer_reviews.title: Best Value in the headphone world
customer_reviews.text: Extreme comfort. Incredible sound. For the money, you can't beat these cans. I'm using them all the time at home.
customer_reviews.author: Elliottok

customer_reviews.title: Overall, great quality headphones.  Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones. I got them for a great price here on Amazon and the quality is amazing. I recommend using in conjunction with an external DAC for best performance. Great sound quality, comfortable, and stylish. My only negative is when wearing for extended periods of time (several hours straight) I can start to feel the pressure of it squeezing my head. I just take a short break and come back to them, I assume because I wear glasses it amplifies that issue. Overall I would recommend buying when on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: It's working well. He is very necessary in my house. The delivery was good. I hope you will always prosper.
customer_reviews.author: yeu chan young

customer_reviews.title: <$250= The right price, nothing more.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty damn good. Neutral sound, no bass really (I have to make ski slopes on the EQ to get an adequate bass response). They are also quite big, but I still wear them around campus despite the bad looks. All in all, $250 is the right price point and I would recommend them at or below that price point only.
customer_reviews.author: Publicname... Shiat

customer_reviews.title: Super clean sound
customer_reviews.text: Super clean sound! Build quality is great! Sound quality is great! I love them. While these do have low end, If your into EDM or bass music, these might not be for you. I have added brainwavz hybrid angled pads & they help with the bass some.
customer_reviews.author: waflet

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as some reviews say. Even when using an external dac/amp.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the hype. Muddy sounding, even with oppo ha2 dac/amp. Returned because of poor sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sci Fi Electronics man

product_meta.title: HIFIMAN HE-400I Over Ear Full-Size Planar Magnetic Headphones Adjustable Headphone with Comfortable Earpads Open-Back Design Easy Cable Swapping
product_meta.description:
Color:GrayThe HIFIMAN HE-400i is a high quality, full-size planar magnetic headphone designed for critical listening in the home or studio. At little more than twelve ounces, HE-400i is 30% lighter than comparable planar magnetic headphones allowing the listener to comfortably enjoy music for hours on end. In addition, a newly-designed headband and beveled hybrid ear pads provide added comfort as well as improved sound quality. Using single-ended drivers, HE-400i delivers a lifelike soundstage and spatial imaging. Its increased efficiency of 93dB allows it to be driven with a modest size amplifier or can even be used with a portable audio player or smartphone. A premium cable is included comprised of Crystalline metal with Oxygen-free copper and silver. HE-400i features ABS polymer ear cups in a gloss charcoal finish.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The HIFIMAN HE-400i is a high quality, full-size planar magnetic headphone designed for critical listening in the home or studio. At little more than twelve ounces, HE-400i is 30% lighter than comparable planar magnetic headphones allowing the listener to comfortably enjoy music for hours on end. In addition, a newly-designed headband and beveled hybrid ear pads provide added comfort as well as improved sound quality. Using single-ended drivers, HE-400i delivers a lifelike soundstage and spatial imaging. Its increased efficiency of 93dB allows it to be driven with a modest size amplifier or can even be used with a portable audio player or smartphone. A premium cable is included comprised of Crystalline metal with Oxygen-free copper and silver. HE-400i features ABS polymer ear cups in a gloss charcoal finish.
Consumer Alert: For Your Protection HIFIMAN products are sold through carefully selected, authorized retail partners to ensure the highest levels of professionalism and service. HIFIMAN products not sold by us, or one of our authorized partners, cannot be verified as authentic and will not receive the HIFIMAN manufacturer's warranty or factory service. Before purchasing, please verify that you are dealing with an authorized HIFIMAN retail partner. You can do that by checking our official website. Help us help you.
feature_bullets: Get an extra three-month extended warranty by registering your products on our official website.
Newly-designed headband with an improved pressure pattern
The FocusPad, new beveled hybrid ear pads made of pleather and velour
Intended for high performance listening in the home or studio

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars648 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
